English (United States)(en-US): Dot!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치야!

English (United States)(en-US): Oh? Oh…… yes!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응? 어…… 응!

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>.

English (United States)(en-US): Hello.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 안녕.

English (United States)(en-US): What were you up to?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭐 하던 중이었어?

English (United States)(en-US): I was gazing at the sky!\nThe weather is so nice today.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나, 하늘을 보고 있었어! 오늘\n날씨가 얼마나 화창한지.

English (United States)(en-US): You can see the sky from your corner?|You call that… nice?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너의 모퉁이에서도 하늘이 보여?|오늘 날씨가… 화창한가?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, yes of course!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 응, 그럼!

English (United States)(en-US): Of course.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그럼.

English (United States)(en-US): I see it, I do.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하늘이 보이지, 그럼.

English (United States)(en-US): (Hmm…… I’m not sure Dot’s alright.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (음……. 뭉치 괜찮은 걸까.)

English (United States)(en-US): (I should check on them again later.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (잠시 후 다시 확인하러 와 봐야겠어.)

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, yes of course!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 응, 그럼!

English (United States)(en-US): Of course.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그럼.

English (United States)(en-US): Nice as anything. I see humans don’t\ngrade this kind of weather as nice?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 화창하지, 그럼. 너희 인간들은 이런\n날씨를 화창하다고 판별하지 않는구나?

English (United States)(en-US): (Does Dot want to be alone?)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (뭉치, 혼자 있고 싶은가?)

English (United States)(en-US): (I should check on them again later.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (잠시 후 다시 확인하러 와 봐야겠어.)

English (United States)(en-US): I think I need to ‘rewind’.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 지금 나에게는 ‘뒤로 가기’가 필요한 것 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): Huh? What do you mean?|Wait, what? What do you mean by that?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응? 무슨 뜻이야?|뭐, 뭐라고? 무슨 뜻이야?

English (United States)(en-US): Hehe. Just wishful thinking out loud.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 히히. 불가능한 바람을 말해 봤을 뿐이야.

English (United States)(en-US): You and me. Where we stand. I read\nEarth is on the third dimension.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너와 나. 지금 우리가 있는 곳. 지구가\n삼차원의 세계에 있다는 글을 봤어.

English (United States)(en-US): They say time in the third dimension only\nflows one way. It can never go backward.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 삼차원의 시간은 반드시 한쪽 방향으로만\n흐른대. 절대로 뒤로 갈 수가 없대.

English (United States)(en-US): The way baked bread can never\nreturn to being runny batter.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 구운 빵이 흐물흐물한\n반죽으로 되돌아갈 수 없듯이.

English (United States)(en-US): The way paper that catches flames\ncan never retrieve its white glow.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 불탄 종이가 다시 고운 흰빛을 띨 수 없듯이.

English (United States)(en-US): They call it an irreversible state.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그걸 비가역적이라고 하나 봐.

English (United States)(en-US): I don’t know where these rules\ncome from… but you and me,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어디서 온 규칙인지 나는 알 수\n없지만… <nickname>도, 나도

English (United States)(en-US): we have no choice but to follow them and\nbe swept in one direction, like riding a wave.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 저항할 수 없는 규칙에 따라 파도를 타듯이\n한쪽으로 휩쓸려갈 수밖에 없는 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): And in the end…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러다 마지막에는 반드시…

English (United States)(en-US): We face death.|(Listen to what Dot has to say.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 죽음을 맞게 되지.|(가만히 뭉치의 말을 기다린다.)

English (United States)(en-US): Hmm…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 음…

English (United States)(en-US): Somewhat unfair. Definitely powerless.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 조금은 부당해. 상당히 무력해.

English (United States)(en-US): A rigid rule that doesn't even show a hint\nof being open to change, no matter what.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어떤 수를 써도 바꿀 수 있다는\n가능성조차 보이지 않는 견고한 규칙.

English (United States)(en-US): That's the rule we follow simply because\nwe were thrust into this world.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그저 세상에 내던져졌다는\n이유로 따라야 하는 규칙이야.

English (United States)(en-US): I don't recall agreeing to it…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 일단 나는 동의한 적이 없는 것 같은데…

English (United States)(en-US): Don't tell me you agreed to it, <nickname>?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어, 혹시 <nickname>은\n동의한 적 있어? … 아니지?

English (United States)(en-US): Me? Of course not.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나? 나도 당연히 그런 적이 없지.

English (United States)(en-US): Whew… I though so. What a relief.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 휴… 역시. 다행이야.

English (United States)(en-US): So I pictured it. A world where I can ‘rewind.’
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래서 상상해 봤어. ‘뒤로 가기’를\n할 수 있는 세상을 말이야.

English (United States)(en-US): Would you like to picture it too?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 같이 상상해 볼래?

English (United States)(en-US): Oh, okay. How?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 으응, 좋아. 어떻게?

English (United States)(en-US): Let's picture us going back\nto the first time we met.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우리가 만난 처음의 시간으로\n돌아가는 모습을 상상해 보자.

English (United States)(en-US): The first time I hid my corner, and the times\nI observed dreams scattered like stars,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나의 모퉁이에 처음 숨어들었던 순간도,\n수많은 별조각 같은 꿈을 관찰하던 순간도

English (United States)(en-US): the times I wrote in my diary\nand we read poetry together,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 일기를 적고 함께 시를 읽는 순간도,

English (United States)(en-US): the times you and I shared, ones I\nresented slightly and adored greatly.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 조금은 원망하고 상당히 애정하던\n<nickname>과 나의 순간들을

English (United States)(en-US): I pictured what it would be like to\nforget everything and start anew.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 모든 걸 잊고 처음부터 ‘완전히\n새롭게’ 시작하는 걸 떠올려 봤어.

English (United States)(en-US): Would we be friends forever?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러면 너와 나는 영원한\n친구가 될 수 있었을까?

English (United States)(en-US): I still would have had fun with you.|Losing the memory may diminish its meaning.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 확실히 너와 계속 노는 건 즐거웠을 거야.|계속 기억을 잃는다면 의미가 없을지도 몰라.

English (United States)(en-US): Hehe. That's true.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 히히. 그건 그래.

English (United States)(en-US): Anyhow, it's mere imagination.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래도 모든 건 상상일 뿐이니까.

English (United States)(en-US): I like to picture you and\nI swirling in time like a ring.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 고리처럼 돌고 도는 시간 속의 너와\n나를 상상하는 것만으로도 즐거워.

English (United States)(en-US): It must be like…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그건 분명히…

English (United States)(en-US): a waltz, one where we spin\nand spin but never get dizzy!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 빙글빙글 돌아도 어지럽지\n않은 왈츠였을 거야!

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>, have you ever met a jellyfish?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 해파리를\n만나 본 적 있어?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, I have.|No, I haven’t.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 있어.|아니, 없어.

English (United States)(en-US): Then have you ever seen a jellyfish’s heart?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그럼 해파리의 심장을 본 적은?

English (United States)(en-US): … Not that I can remember.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): …. 없는 것 같은데.

English (United States)(en-US): I thought so. Humans don’t typically question\nwhether something has a heart at first sight.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇구나. 인간이 무언가를 마주할 때\n심장의 유무를 궁금해 하지는 않으니까.

English (United States)(en-US): Did you know? I read in a book\nthat jellyfish don’t have hearts.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그거 알아? 책에서 봤는데,\n해파리는 심장이 없대.

English (United States)(en-US): Really? Is that possible?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 정말? 그게 가능해?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes. They shed all that weight and swim\nserenely with their transparent body.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응. 심장의 무게를 벗고 투명한\n몸으로 유유히 헤엄치는 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Long after beings with hearts\nhave lain down to rest.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 심장이 있는 것들이 모두\n스러지고 나서도 아주 오랫동안.

English (United States)(en-US): I have a question for those jellyfish.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그런 해파리들에게 궁금한 게 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): Does no heart mean no emotions?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 심장이 없으면 마음도 없는 걸까?

English (United States)(en-US): Can neither hurt nor love tear at their\ninsides if they don’t have a heart?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어떤 상처도 사랑도, 심장이 없는\n그들을 헤집어 놓을 수는 없는 걸까.

English (United States)(en-US): At times when my beating\nheart weighs me down,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 가끔 내 안에서 콩닥거리는 심장이\n너무 무겁게 느껴질 때면,

English (United States)(en-US): I long to be a jellyfish and float freely.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 해파리가 되어 자유로이\n떠오르고 싶어져.

English (United States)(en-US): If you ever meet one in person, could you\ncheck for me whether they have a heart?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 혹시 나중에 해파리를 만나게 되면,\n정말로 심장이 없는지 살펴봐 줄래?

English (United States)(en-US): And just how gracefully they swim.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그리고 그들의 유영이\n얼마나 아름다운지도.

English (United States)(en-US): What makes summer\nso lovely as a season?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 무엇이 여름이라는 계절을\n사랑스럽게 만드는 걸까?

English (United States)(en-US): Think of summer in poems\nand novels, or movies.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 시나 소설, 영화에서\n등장하는 여름을 떠올려봐.

English (United States)(en-US): They are full of life and energy,\nor unforgettable heat.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 대부분 생기와 활기, 또는\n잊지 못할 열기로 가득 차 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>, what is your summer like?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 너의 여름은 어때?

English (United States)(en-US): Do you feel the unique\nthrum of summer?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너도 여름만의 박동을 느껴?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, summer is special to me.|No, summer is just hot.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 여름은 특별한 계절이야.|아니, 여름은 그저 더운 계절이야.

English (United States)(en-US): I see.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너도 그렇구나.

English (United States)(en-US): I thought so too when I looked\nup summer in my encyclopedia…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나도 백과사전에서 여름을 찾았을\n때는 그렇게 생각했었는데…

English (United States)(en-US): Some humans want to mark their\nsummers like a page of a book.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어떤 인간들에게 여름은 책갈피를\n남기고 싶은 계절인가봐.

English (United States)(en-US): In their summers, leaves of\ngreen shades melt into light.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그들의 여름 안에선, 초록을\n머금은 잎이 빛에 스며들어.

English (United States)(en-US): Children run with long shadows\nhanging onto their heels,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아이들이 그림자를\n늘어뜨린 채 뛰어다니고,

English (United States)(en-US): and the sound of bicycle wheels\nrolling beneath the shade.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그늘 밑을 구르는 자전거\n바퀴 소리가 들리지.

English (United States)(en-US): Everything is vivid enough to touch\nand yet could vanish in an instant.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 모든 게 만져질 듯이 선명하면서도\n홀연히 사라질 것 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): Beautiful, beautiful, blinding.\nAnd yet strangely…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아름다워, 아름답지, 눈이 부셔.\n그런데 이상하게도…

English (United States)(en-US): I can’t picture myself in the scene.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 풍경 속에 있는 나를\n그려 보기는 어렵네.

English (United States)(en-US): The pouring light won’t\nlet me be as dark as I like.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 쏟아지는 빛 속에서는 마음껏\n어두워지지 못할 테니까.

English (United States)(en-US): If damp and clinging beings\nwere to hide from the sun,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 혹여나 습하고 질척이는 존재들이\n해를 피해 숨어 버린다면,

English (United States)(en-US): I too would crawl into some invisible\ncorner of summer and lament.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나도 여름 속 보이지 않는 어느\n구석으로 함께 기어 들어가 슬퍼할래.
